text.section:
The articles of incorporation of a cooperative may contain any provision that:
Is consistent with this subtitle; and
Is considered necessary or advisable for the conduct of the business of the cooperative.
The articles of incorporation need not state the purpose for which the cooperative is organized or any of its corporate powers.
The articles of incorporation shall be signed by each incorporator and acknowledged by at least two of the incorporators, or on their behalf, if they are cooperatives.
